Father and son investment bankers W. Don Cornwell and K. Don Cornwell describe racial bias on Wall Street over the decades -- and how much still needs to change.

"What we have seen over the years is that people of color have really lost out during the staffing process," said K. Don Cornwell, who serves on EHTP's Board of Trustees. "They are not getting premium projects, which can negatively impact how people perceive their talent level. ... If you hire somebody of color that you think is going to be a star, you need to invest the time and effort to make sure that they are getting a fair shake. Because over the last 50 years there has not been a fair shake."

Read the Bloomberg Markets article, which is part of ‚ÄúThe Only One in the Room,‚Äù an oral history of the Black experience on Wall Street.

How do you #BuildLove? At East Harlem Tutorial Program and our Scholars Academies, it happens in anti-racist teaching spaces where students are seen and heard. In the words of Dr. Harvey, it's "a kind of love where students know at the end of the day, they have somebody who is willing to rsist alongside them."

#COVID19 may have changed WHERE we teach, but not HOW we teach. Our educators are #determined to continue individualized, equitable instruction in culturally responsive virtual classrooms -- and our organization is determined to serve our community with technology, meals, and grants to get through these unprecedented times. You can support these efforts through our Emergency Response Fund -- https://ehtp.org/donate

In following the city, state, and CDC‚Äôs new guidance, all East Harlem Scholars Academies, our after-school and College Scholars programs and our Central office are closed until further notice (there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the EHTP community). We anticipate returning no earlier than Monday, April 20.

The good news -- our scholars are continuing to learn! Our educators worked around the clock to ensure that plans were in place and they were online with their students first thing this morning; meanwhile, we are preparing packets to carry them through the next four weeks. As of today we:

-- Distributed more than 500 laptops to scholars and their families;
-- Gave out close to 200 Wifi hotspots;
-- Passed out 130 grab-and-go meals, and partnered with surrounding organizations to share even more.
-- Turned our gymnasium into a library for College Scholars whose campuses have closed (with a 15-person max for social distancing).

Stay tuned for more updates in the coming days, and stay safe! #BuildLove
